text: Anyone know a way to get the region code rather that the name with {{request.geoip_region}}. Would be nice if it just returned DC
I don't, but you could try this {{ request.geoip_region|replace('distric of columbia", "DC") }}

hey folks, need you help I am using the menu hubl code, Is there any option to add hubl for the advance menu type, it should be static or dynamic, I want add dynamic menu type. Not able to figure out, can you guys help
use a `<script>` tag in the HTML/HubL section of a module.  You can’t put HubL in the CSS or JS sections of a custom module to my knowledge
I wonder if I found an old reference to it, pre-v2 custom modules
v1 modules didn’t have css and js panes
I'm going to go back and find that darn thing that I read.
:joy: my brain was all.... "BUT THIS SHOULD WORK". Well it did. I'm glad I'm not entirely crazy
Is it possible, using the API or a hubl variable, to get the number of contacts in a list and have it display on a page? I’m not concerned with who the contacts are, just the number.
never tried to do it but I think you might be able to with <https://designers.HubSpot.com/en/docs/hubl/hubl-supported-functions#crm-object>
or by looping through objects checking if they’re in the list and adding to a counter or to an array and outputting it’s length
Note this would only be visisble on a membership page or password protected page
i would need it to be unprotected unfortunately :disappointed:

want whole querystring in alert
